sen.j: 伊藤 源助（いとう げんすけ、天保13年（1842年）? - 明治2年12月29日 (旧暦)（1870年1月30日））は新選組平隊士、または新選組入隊志願者。
sen.e: Gensuke Ito (born 1842?, died January 30, 1870) was a regimental soldier in the shinsengjumi, and was someone who had submitted an application to enlist in the shinsengumi.
Gensuke ITO (date of birth unknown, 1842 - January 30, 1870) was a regimental soldier in the shinsengjumi, and was someone who had submitted an application to enlist in the shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: Itoを大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: Gensuke ITO (date of birth unknown, 1842 - January 30, 1870) was a regimental soldier in the shinsengjumi, and was someone who had submitted an application to enlist in the shinsengumi.
Real name: Ainosuke KATO
Real name: Ainosuke KATO
Real name: Ainosuke KATO
He was a masterless samurai of Shirakawa Domain.
He was a masterless samurai of Shirakawa Domain.
He was a masterless samurai of Shirakawa Domain.

sen.j: 明治二年末、大村益次郎の殺害に加わったとして処刑される。
sen.e: He was executed in 1870 for having taken part in the murder of Masujiro OMURA.
He was executed in the end of 1869 for having taken part in the murder of Masujiro OMURA.
He was executed in the end of 1869 for having taken part in the murder of Masujiro OMURA.

sen.j: 以下、異説のある部分である。
sen.e: The following are historically unsubstantiated assertions.
The following are historically unsubstantiated assertions.
The following are historically unsubstantiated assertions.

sen.j: 広瀬時宏と同一人物だと思われる。
sen.e: Hi is the one and the same person as Tokihiro HIROSE.
He is the one and the same person as Tokihiro HIROSE.
He is the one and the same person as Tokihiro HIROSE.

sen.j: 西村兼文『壬生浪士始末記』では、伊藤源助は新選組入隊を志すも許されず、退去したと認められている。
sen.e: Acording to the account given by Kanefumi NISHIMURA in "Mibu Roshi Shimatsuki", Genosuke Ito had wanted to join the shinsengumi, but was rejected, and withdrew.
According to the account given by Kanefumi NISHIMURA in "Mibu Roshi Shimatsuki," Genosuke Ito had wanted to join the shinsengumi, but was rejected, and withdrew.
According to the account given by Kanefumi NISHIMURA in "Mibu Roshi Shimatsuki," Genosuke Ito had wanted to join the shinsengumi, but was rejected, and withdrew.
